xtagTextFragments.SacredThing: having neither arms nor legs nor a head

tag.Name: SimpleConversation
tag.Value: {{emote|*whatever this being is, it gives no indication of understanding you*}}

xtagTextFragments.PoeticFeatures: vast shoulders,eerie lack of a head,nightmarish bearing

part.Name: Description
part.Short: It permits no silence around the shape that is its self. Inscrutable ravings spill forth from the depths of its throat, only occasionally broken up by frenzied breathing or the sudden, agonied howl. Perhaps this is why it is so eager to sink its forearm-sized teeth into anything that happens to come close enough for it to reach: We are beings of silence, and it, to its essence, is not. Though of course, there is always the possibility that it simply bites because it is hungry.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: You tell yourself that it has no face, that it is only an eye without even as much as a lid. You tell yourself that out of all the emotions found in the world, there is none that can be displayed solely through the dilations and the contortions of an eye. You tell yourself that it has no brain, that surely it cannot think and that certainly it cannot judge. It does not help. Meeting the gaze of that vast and staring thing, you cannot shake the feeling that it looks at you as though it sees something inside you that nobody else ever has.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Countless ridges and valleys mar the surface of the grayish dome, and amidst these valleys, a pattern can be traced. What hand has carved the lines of a half-remembered poem into this vast and bulging cerebrum? Why are the shapes of the folds in this brain so similar to the shapes of the clouds around the Spindle? Is that the face of a loved one? Step closer, and you may come to understand.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Stray elbows and shoulder-joints knot the inside of each appendage as they sway and wave in a wind unknown to all but them.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Each heartbeat is a drumbeat is the rumbling of a thunder that compels you that demands you to come closer to indulge it in its cadence with the drumming of your fingers and the tapping of your shoe-tips that arises from your bloodstream with its origin in your heartbeat is a drumbeat is the rumbling of a thunder.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Shivering capillaries reach up towards the shin, eager for the mingling of your blood with theirs.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A wound that is deep enough has a tendency to reopen even long after it appears to have healed. A sudden motion or presistent strain may draw blood even from half-faded scars, and time itself can cause a hairline-crack in the base of a statue to spread until the stony edifice suddenly collapses into rubble. Tremors in the earth expose not only the hidden wounds in the buildings that collapse, but also the wounds in the minds of those that raised them. Such a wound stands before you now, rimmed with jagged teeth, its presence carving the questions into your head: Who first opened this wound, and for how long has it remained unopened? Why is it only now that it has reopened?

part.Name: Description
part.Short: There is something profoundly ill about the notion of a brain contorted into human shape. Things that should only touch the walls of the skull now touch the ground, and substances which should be held within the spine now grasp for air. Even the thought of striking it feels like a blasphemy.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: That same nerve that once hoisted images from the life-world into the mind-world now hoists the swollen eye-thing towards the heavens.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Motions repeat in spasms as the hand-thing hobbles towards whatever its strange instinct drives it towards. Here is the instinctive grasp for the hand of a friend, here is the fond caress of a lover's face, here is the practiced mirroring of an unseen other's embrace. The pantomime folds in on itself, interrupts itself and returns to itself, all in service of a singular theme: Its player, with its countless ceaseless hands, is something that wants to hold you very, very close.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A beating human heart is held aloft by a crooked neck of thrumming flesh. Despite the mass of thumping muscle where a face should be, it carries itself with an almost regal bearing, as though it were a hierarch to the restless pools of blood that surround its wake.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Blood has always held a position of esteem amidst the metaphors we reach for when we wish to elucidate the acts and the aftermaths of violence. It is the substance in which generals drown their battlefields, it is the sacrament that the frenzied crowd thirsts for, it is the currency in which striving families pay for their gathered misdeeds, back and forth and then back again. But to see blood itself as a fighting thing, as the agent of violence rather than its result, is a thing for which no metaphor truly fits. If you were a poet, perhaps you could invent one, but you are no poet. And neither is the blood.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The pilgrim-physician steadies =pronouns.reflexive= on a gnarled wooden stick, and wraps the folds of coarse-weave tighter around =pronouns.possessive= slender frame. They have returned to Qud en masse, they say, to commemorate an occasion most solemn to their Order.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Only scraps remain of that mendicant regality with which the preachers carried themselves when they first began to wander into Qud a month or so ago, singing monodies to their Sultan and whispering hurriedly among themselves of a new and unknown plague. Gone is the trained precision of the surgeon's hands, and something strange and restless has grown into =pronouns.possessive= motions in its place. =pronouns.Possessive= traveler's frock is ragged, =pronouns.possessive= shawl is stained in grime, and though it is hard to make out in the shadow cast by =pronouns.possessive= wide-brimmed hat, you swear you can see a glint of eerie hunger in =pronouns.possessive= eyes. Something small catches the light beneath =pronouns.possessive= dirty robes. A knife?

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
A tall figure steadies themselves on an ornate scepter, bowing their head to the ground in mourning. All around them, tattered corpses litter the ground.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
A tall and hooded figure huddles beneath an elaborately embroidered robe. Closer inspection reveals that the figure is in fact composed of a myriad small humanoid sculptures, humans, mopango, and urshiib, arranged into the form of a single shape beneath the robe.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
A congregation of small humanoid figures kneel on an empty field, bowing their heads to the ground and weeping. Seen from afar, the combined shapes of the figures form the outline of a single large figure laid on its back like a corpse.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
A massive, weeping human head, its features hidden beneath a smooth and unadorned mask. In the stead of tears, small humanoid figures are climbing down across its cheeks.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
A massive human torso, dismembered and disemboweled. From the gaping wound in its chest, a winding procession of little humans, snapjaws, goatfolk and other humanoid shapes are marching out across a scarred and blighted wasteland.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
Two humanoid figures in the apparel of physicians, standing over a hospital bed. One figure's face is hidden beneath an unadorned mask, while the other, clad in a habit and bearing an unfamiliar symbol in her brow, has an expression of anger and grief on her gaunt-looking face. The bed between them is empty, aside from a single severed tongue.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
An armored figure wielding an ornate spear gazes out over a large battlefield, tears streaking their masked face. Everywhere below, a multitude of various shapes, small and large, living and mechanical, are being devoured by an unending onslaught of strange and spiderlike things of varying shapes and sizes.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
A figure in an ornate crown pushes a shovel into the muddy earth beneath their jeweled sandals. All around them, open graves await their inhabitants.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
A tall figure in an unadorned mask cradles the shape of a woman in their arms. The woman is dressed in a long, austere robe, and an unfamiliar symbol has been carved into her forehead. From her eyes and her mouth, a viscous substance drips into a puddle on the ground before them.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
A tall and regal figure in a heavy robe kneels on a scarred plain. A single hand extends from within the robe, contorting and transforming into a shoal of small human figures where it makes contact with the ground. From what little can be seen of the figure's cheek beneath the hood, a circuit pattern extends down from its lower lip.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
This shrine depicts a gruesome event of unknown significance:
A kneeling figure ritually disemboweling themselves. One hand holds a knife, while the intestines that have coiled around the other hand are covered in eyes and mouths.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The forces of slaughter have rearranged the parts of the body, and here they lie, rearranging themselves in accordance to the will of some other, stranger force. Forms of motion once confined to the world of the living are now writhing through the skin of the dead, and the corpse shudders and spasms like a sleeper in the thores of a nightmare. Something has died here, and something else is struggling to be born.

part.Name: FallsApart
part.Message: {{r|The mass of viscera =verb:contort=, and a number of terrifying shapes take form.}}

part.Name: FallsApart
part.Message: {{r|The mass of viscera =verb:contort=, and a number of terrifying shapes take form.}}

object.Name: High Dervish of the Sightless Way_Frenzied
object.Inherits: High Dervish of the Sightless Way

part.Name: Description
